notes.text: with object and adverbial of direction

definitions: cause (a liquid) to be ejected from a small opening in a thin, fast stream or jet

examples.text: she squirted soda into a glass

shortDefinitions: cause liquid to be ejected from small opening in thin, fast stream or jet

definitions: cause (a container of liquid) to eject its contents in a thin, fast stream

examples.text: some youngsters squirted a water pistol in her face

shortDefinitions: cause container of liquid to eject its contents

definitions: wet with a jet or stream of liquid

examples.text: she squirted me with the juice from her lemon wedge

shortDefinitions: wet with jet or stream of liquid

definitions: (of a liquid) be ejected from something in a thin, fast stream

examples.text: tread on one of these and a jet of water squirts up your leg

notes.text: no object, with adverbial of direction

shortDefinitions: be ejected from something in thin

definitions: (of an object) move suddenly and unpredictably

examples.text: he got his glove on the ball but it squirted away

notes.text: no object, with adverbial of direction

definitions: transmit (information) in highly compressed or speeded-up form

examples.text: radio equipment could squirt a million words from one continent to another

shortDefinitions: transmit information in highly compressed or speeded-up form

definitions: a thin stream or small quantity of liquid ejected from something
shortDefinitions: thin stream or small quantity of liquid squirted from something

definitions: a small device from which a liquid may be ejected in a thin, fast stream.
shortDefinitions: small device from which liquid may be squirted

definitions: a person perceived to be insignificant, impudent, or presumptuous

examples.text: what did he see in this patronizing little squirt?

definitions: a compressed radio signal transmitted at high speed.
shortDefinitions: compressed radio signal transmitted at high speed
